item.title: On the vedic anusvAra.
item.description: The shaunaka, mAnDukya, pANini and other authorities have declared that the anusvAra ‘M’ in its original state is a voiced sound involving only the nAsika and no other oral articulation (e.g. anusvAra yamAnAM cha nAsikA sthAnaM uchyate). This differentiates it from the other anunAsikas such as ‘ma’, ‘na’ Na, ‘~na’, ‘~Na’ which are sounds with specific oral articulations that are tinged with passage of air through the nasal cavity. In the pure anusvAra the mouth is kept naturally closed without forming any particular articulation and the air is allowed to pass, superficially contacting the oral cavity into the nasal cavity.
